item.title: How to freeze your credit after a data breach
item.description:
Back in 2017, Equifax announced that hackers stole half of the US population’s Social Security numbers in what, we said, “will likely end up being one of the worst data breaches to ever affect the country.” Perhaps — until this year, when about 2.9 billion rows of data were collected through a breach at National Public Data (NPD), a company that resells collected personal data for background checks. This data included names, Social Security numbers, and other personal information.

As usual, when this sort of thing hits the news, our immediate reaction is to wonder what we can do to prevent ourselves from falling prey to identity theft, unauthorized withdrawals, false credit applications, and other nasty consequences. And, also, as...

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Barbara Krasnoff

item.title: Senators want investigation of AI-enabled ammo vending machines
item.description:
AI-enabled ammunition vending machines could facilitate mass shootings and let people circumvent federal bans prohibiting people with certain criminal convictions from buying ammunition, two senators warn.

Massachusetts Senators Ed Markey and Elizabeth Warren sent a letter to the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives (ATF) asking it to “closely examine” facial recognition-enabled ammunition vending machines that have recently been installed in supermarkets in certain states.

“Easy access to ammunition helps to fuel our country’s gun violence epidemic, which now claims more than 44,000 lives annually.”

The machines, distributed by the Texas-based company American Rounds, began appearing in grocery stores in Alabama, Texas,...

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Gaby Del Valle

item.title: D-ID launches an AI video translation tool that includes voice cloning and lip sync
item.description:
AI video creation platform D-ID is the latest company to ship a tool for translating videos into other languages using AI technologies. However, in this case, D-ID also clones the speaker’s voice and changes their lip movements to match the translated words as part of the AI editing process. The technology stems from D-ID’s earlier […]

item.description:

item.title: Microsoft will release controversial Windows Recall AI search feature to testers in October
item.description: It's been a bumpy rollout for a feature that was designed as an early example of an artificial intelligence model running locally on a Windows PC.

item.title: Why Is Big Tech Opposing California Bill On Artificial Intelligence?
item.description: California legislators are set to vote on a bill as soon as this week that would broadly regulate how artificial intelligence is developed and deployed in California even as a number of tech giants have voiced broad opposition.

item.title: Tesla Issues Recall For 9,100 Model X SUVs Over Trim Issue
item.description: Tesla has issued a recall for about 9,100 Model X sports utility vehicles in the US over a trim on the roof that could separate, it said on Wednesday, its second over the same issue since 2020.
